channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Bitcoin $100,000 and Dow 45,000: Don’t overlook this part of ‘everything’ rally
Biden says US troops will remain in Syria to fight ISIS as Assad regime collapses
item.description: U.S. forces on Sunday conducted air strikes on Islamic State camps and operations in Syria, Biden said.

item.title: Why the case against a Roth conversion gets stronger if Trump tax cuts continue
Who is Al-Jolani, the Syrian rebel who ended Assad’s rule?
item.description: Al-Jolani joined al-Qaeda in Iraq after the US invasion and was detained and jailed by the Americans there.

item.title: Generative AI can’t shake its reliability problem. Some say ‘neurosymbolic AI’ is the answer
item.description: Neurosymbolic AI could be a best-of-both-worlds marriage between deep learning and "good old-fashioned AI."

item.title: Stocks and crypto may rally through year-end, but watch for this last wild card
As TikTok vows to take U.S. ban to Supreme Court, Meta and Google may benefit
Beats by Dre designer Robert Brunner’s advice for creatives trying to make themselves heard: ‘Go take the comedy class’
item.description: "Learn how to stand up in front of people to communicate thoughts and ideas”, Ammunition founder Robert Brunner said at Fortune Brainstorm Design.

item.title: Costco’s results will show us how important bargains still are for shoppers
This was Bashar al-Assad’s mansion. Syrians are now helping themselves to its opulence after the ousted dictator fled to Russia
item.description: Crowds could be seen snatching clothes, plates and whatever belongings they could find including a Louis Vuitton cardboard shopping bag.
